item.title: The FCC is reportedly fining Verizon, T-Mobile, Sprint, and AT&T for selling customer location data
item.description: Your mobile telephone company can even be on the hook for fines from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) for selling your accurate-time plight data. In accordance with the Wall Avenue Journal, the FCC needs AT&T, Lag, T-Cell, and Verizon to pay hundreds of hundreds and hundreds in fines.
